result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Mirgai, Tammy Jane

records.addlTxt: Court approves zoom appr for def.  Email sent to counsel with zoom link.
to appear by zoom with medical note filed by Atty Carson - doc for review to Court

12:06 PM Cases called: 22CF371/22CM313 Defendant Tammy Jane Mirgai not in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Record made by response of attorney Carson to DA's office only regarding rescheduled hearing. Court quashes warrant and reinstates bail.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on November 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $5000.00

8:57 AM Cases called: 22CF371/22CM313 Defendant Tammy Jane Mirgai not in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history and adjournment request of counsel. State requests warrant. Court issues warrant based on nonappearance of Defendant and forfeits bail.
Clerk emailed counsel potential dates for adjourned hearing.
Request for adjournment. Filed by attorney Carson. Document for review to B2.

Adjustment Number: 22A 151305,
Payable Number: 142631,
Receipt Number: 22R 010898,
Amount: $20.00
Sheriff's Office advises bond was posted on 10/12/2022.

No contact with the residence on El Patio Lane listed in the complaint. No contact with SMM or JJK. Defendant to avoid SMM or JJK's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by tSMM or JJK. The defendant avoid contacting SMM or JJK or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact SMM or JJK. Contact includes: contact at SMM or JJK's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

1:21 PM Defendant Tammy Jane Mirgai appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Tammy Jane Mirgai.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel is unable to determine if Defendant qualifies for PD. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $2000 cash bail w/conditions. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
